poem:
Title: "Aquatic Echoes"

Tales of water wax and wane,
in the solace of its saline reign.
Leviathans of memory lurk, 
beneath its surface, wisdoms work.
Eternal womb of mankind's birth, 
our draw to depths, elemental mirth.
Turmoil tamed, placid peace,
from water's grip, we seek release.
Yet yearn for its gentle touch,
Nothing soothes, nor startles much.
